page.title: 11WHEATHAM FARM,Steep Marsh,1
page.content: {HISTORICAL BACKGROUND} The farm lies just north of Steep Marsh It is mentioned in the Domesday Book .The house itself is mainly fifteenth century and had connections with a former nunnery at Liss Place. Many people believe there is a secret passage between the house and the old nunnery.In some places you can see mullioned windows and local stone is very plentiful. There are also very large corner stones and some very old bricks laid diagonally .There are ships beams inside and two dungeons one beneath the other. On the site there are the remains of an oast house.The word Wheatham is Saxon and plenty of remains of former times have been found in the soil around.The farm has about 200 acres(not including the Hangers are also a part of Wheatham Farm).
